featured.text: When Jeffery doesn’t feel like cooking, he often orders pizza online and has it ______ to his house.
In this course, you will learn __(22)__ to cook two weeks of healthy, inexpensive meals in just one day.
Emma and Joe are looking for a live-in babysitter for their three-year-old twins, one who knows how to cook.
The children who help cook food.
The researchers found that children who had cooked their own foods were more likely to eat those foods in the cafeteria than children who had not.

other.text: With its delicate taste, the fresh onion is an ideal choice for salads and other lightly-cooked dishes.

At the end of the class, you __(25)__ with you classmates the meals you have created, and you will leave with recipe handouts and , more importantly, the ability to cook two weeks of fantastic, low-cost meals.
By this time the cook was angry and decided to do exactly what the dinner guest wanted: slice the potatoes as thin as possible.
For these reasons, storage onions are the best choice for spicy dishes that require longer cooking times or more flavor.
I tried one when I was a prep cook for Next Level Burgers…tasted awful, just like mashed peas gone to rot.
The cook’s plan to stop the dinner guest from complaining did not turn out as he had planned.
According to this passage, the cook of the Moon Lake Restaurant _______.
Although he is a chef, Roberto _____ cooks his own meals.
The cook sliced some potatoes thinner than before and prepared them for the complaining guest.

definition.zh_def: 烹飪，準備食物的過程或行為。
definition.en_def: To prepare food by heating it.
definition.example: I love to cook dinner for my family on weekends.
